cab.content: is Britaifit.BOARD OF AGRICULTURE FOR SCOTLAND. Report for the Vfeek ondinp; Oth July, 1919.I, ABRI CULTURE.1. Supply of Fertilisers.(a) Sulphate of Ammonia.Particulars (i) of the production and delivorieo eaoh month of Sulphato of Ammonia in Scotland from 1st June 1918 to 51st May, 1919.(ii) of tho quantities 'of Sulphate of Ammonia liconsod by the Board for use in each county of Scotland during tho year 1st Juno, 1918 - ,31st May, 1919 under the Fertilisers Pricos Order 1918, and(iii) a summary showing the total pro-tduotion of Sulphate of Ammonia in Scotland and the mannor of its -disposal, aro given in the attached statements.(b) Basic Slag.A summary is annexed showing tho monthly production of ground basic slag at each of the Scottish Slag Works for the year June 1917 to May 191G, and for the year Juno 1918 to May 1910.s* CORN PRODUCTION APT, 1917, PART I.- CLAIMS.A sorios of Conferences have boon hold between groups of Executive Officers and reprosentativos of tho Board for the discussion of tho prooedure to be followed in inspecting farms for the purpose of verifying.tho acro-jage of cereal crops stated in the schedules for the Annual Agricultural Returns.H. PUBLIC WORKS In the 0R0FTIKG COUNTIES.In terms of the Congested Districts (Scotland) Act 1897 a grant has been approved for the completion of a road through the Bays of Harris (South Harris). A short section of the road was const ruetod in 1915 by means of funds provided by the Board and about 5f miles yet romain to be made. Whon tho road is completed all tho townships cn tho East side of Harris will havo easy acoess to Tarbert at the north or Rodol at tho south ond of the island.Ill/ iii.
